intro: Stiefia compressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf stiefia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Stiefia compressa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
